meanings.definition: (verb) to move quickly with short, hurried steps
meanings.sent1: The mouse will scurry across the floor to find some cheese.
meanings.sent2: The children scurry to finish their homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to scurry up the tree to escape the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scurry by as she raced to finish her work before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The ants scurry around the picnic blanket, searching for crumbs to bring back to their nest.

meanings.definition: (noun) a quick, hurried movement or action
meanings.sent1: The sudden scurry of feet caught her attention in the quiet hallway.
meanings.sent2: The scurry of the wind through the leaves created a soothing sound in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The scurry of the busy bees in the garden made her smile at their hard work.
meanings.sent4: She heard the scurry of the mouse in the attic, causing her to jump in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The scurry of shoppers in the mall made it difficult to navigate through the crowd.
